text: Checks whether a value is not a number.
Returns 1 if the given value is not a number.
Returns 0 if it is a normal number or infinite.

NAN, or Not A Number, is a special value floating point numbers can be set to
to signal something has gone wrong in the computation.  They are carried
forward by all further operations (adding or multiplying with them produces
more NANs) and tend to cause problems with downstream operations.
In traditional programming, these are generated by 0/0 or

, but in VEX
most such operations are guarded so normally VEX will not produce NANs.

title: isnan
summary: Checks whether a value is not a number.
